title: How allocate memory on Kernel mode by windbg?
content:
How allocate memory on Kernel mode by windbg?
I use .dvalloc on user mode but not working on kernel mode
thanks.

comments.text:
Are you trying to allocate kernel memory through 
windbg -k
or are you trying to allocate user-space memory through 
windbg -k
?
Windows' kernel debugger engine API does not provide an interface to allocate memory, so there is likely no WinDbg command to do so.
